elements.title: Dreamtime (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dreamtime (pictured) is one of the world's most famous bouldering routes?

elements.title: Jopie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jopie and Teun Roosenburg led an art colony at Oost Castle that helped Jewish refugees escape the Nazi-occupied Netherlands to Belgium?

elements.title: Flyover (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Flyover, a 2023 science fiction novel by an American author, portraying a dystopian future where part of the US becomes a theocracy, was published in French but not in English?

elements.title: Anna Russell Cole (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Anna Russell Cole, a significant benefactor of Vanderbilt University, donated $10,000 in 1926 to endow the office of dean of women?

elements.title: The Servile State (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in The Servile State, Hilaire Belloc criticized socialism for being too similar to capitalism?

elements.title: Dot and Bubble (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2024 Doctor Who episode "Dot and Bubble" was first conceptualized in 2009?

elements.title: Gmac Cash (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that rapper Gmac Cash attempted to gift a pair of Cartier glasses to Gretchen Whitmer, the governor of Michigan?

elements.title: a snowy NFL game (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Tampa Bay Buccaneers players wore white uniforms during a snowy NFL game, which made them extremely difficult for their quarterback to see?

elements.title: Barbara's Rhubarb Bar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that barbarians would have bought cake, not pie, at Barbara's Rhubarb Bar?
